definition: The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way
example: Meeting my best friend was pure serendipity.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing
example: The speaker delivered an eloquent presentation on climate change.

definition: Lasting for a very short time
example: Cherry blossoms are ephemeral, blooming only in spring.

definition: To persist in an undertaking despite difficulty
example: She persevered through years of training to become an athlete.

definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
example: The chef was meticulous about preparing each ingredient.

definition: Open to more than one interpretation; unclear
example: The instructions were ambiguous, causing confusion.
The benevolent donor funded the entire school project.
Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

definition: Dealing with things in a realistic way based on practical consequences
example: We need a pragmatic approach to solve this problem.
The professor gave a lucid explanation of quantum physics.
His petulant behavior annoyed everyone at the meeting.

definition: Having or showing care and effort in one's work or duties
example: Her diligent studies helped her pass the exam.

definition: Something that deviates from what is standard or expected
example: The unusual weather pattern was an anomaly for this season.

definition: Able to be touched or felt; real or concrete
example: We finally saw tangible results from our efforts.

definition: Sentimental desire to return to a past time
example: Looking at old photos made me nostalgic for my childhood.

definition: To clear someone of blame or suspicion
example: The new evidence helped vindicate the wrongly accused person.
